thread.title: Los Angeles Times Publisher Ross Levinsohn to Go on Unpaid Leave of Absence

author: Sarah Rabil
title: Los Angeles Times Publisher Ross Levinsohn to Go on Unpaid Leave of Absence
text:
Ross Levinsohn, the publisher and chief executive of the Los Angeles Times, has voluntarily agreed to take an unpaid leave of absence while parent company Tronc Inc. investigates allegations of workplace misconduct at his prior places of employment, according to the company.
Tronc has hired an outside law firm, Sidley Austin LLP, to conduct a review of the matter, Tronc Chief Executive Justin Dearborn said in a memo to employees on Friday.
